intro: Quercus polymorpha, commonly known as the variable oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, including parts of Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from elliptical to ovate, depending on the environment. Its acorns are typically small and have a scaly cap, and the tree can grow to a height of up to 20 meters. Quercus polymorpha plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
